title: Model-Based Reinforcement Learning Control of Reaction-Diffusion Problems
abstract: arXiv:2402.14446v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Mathematical and computational tools have proven to be reliable in decision-making processes. In recent times, in particular, machine learning-based methods are becoming increasingly popular as advanced support tools. When dealing with control problems, reinforcement learning has been applied to decision-making in several applications, most notably in games. The success of these methods in finding solutions to complex problems motivates the exploration of new areas where they can be employed to overcome current difficulties. In this paper, we explore the use of automatic control strategies to initial boundary value problems in thermal and disease transport. Specifically, in this work, we adapt an existing reinforcement learning algorithm using a stochastic policy gradient method and we introduce two novel reward functions to drive the flow of the transported field. translated_title: 基于模型的强化学习对反应扩散问题的控制

tldr: 本文探索了使用自动控制策略处理热和疾病传输初始边界值问题，并通过引入新的奖励函数和改进的强化学习算法来驱动传输场的流动。
